author: ajh
title: NASCAR Launches First FAST Channel
text:
NASCAR Launches First FAST Channel
NASCAR is launching a Free Ad-Supported Television (FAST) channel called the "NASCAR Channel" on January 29 with exclusive partner Tubi.
The streaming platform will broadcast NASCAR content 24/7 without a subscription fee or registration. Programming and content on the NASCAR Channel will include classic races, re-airs of this season's events, documentaries, NASCAR studios original content and video podcasts.
Upcoming highlights also include live coverage of the NASCAR Hall of Fame Induction Ceremony on February 7 and the Cook Out Madhouse Classic from Bowman Gray Stadium in Winston-Salem, North Carolina, on February 1.
"I'm excited for the fans," said John Dahl, NASCAR SVP, Content. "They now have a free, easily-accessed, 24/7 NASCAR destination that not only digs deep into our archives but provides the latest news and original storytelling. As the channel grows, we'll be adding more and more racing content that we're confident fans will appreciate. Many NASCAR fans already use Tubi, but we're looking forward to exposing more of them to that great platform too."
For more information, visit nascar.com.
topics: Arts, Culture and Entertainment->online media outlet
